info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 3:47PM EDT until May 31 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts, including the following county, Berkshire and east central New York, including the following county, Rensselaer.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsfield, Hoosick Falls, Stephentown, Grafton, Berlin, Hancock, Averill Park, West Sand Lake, Center Brunswick, Berkshire, Brunswick, Sand Lake, Pittstown, Poestenkill, Lanesborough, Schaghticoke, East Nassau, Valley Falls, Bucks Corner and Center Berlin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING
